p: Here, various frameworks [169], [170] can be used to scrutinise how changes also come about: whether it is bouncing back, i.e. maintaining the status quo, mainstream pathways, as could be the case of recovering from COVID-19 only to return to the previous norm of exclusion and inequality [171]; whether it is about transitions, i.e. incremental changes or on-stream/off-stream pathways, as is the case of Green New Deals; or whether it refers to transformational, radical change, which implies not only a socio-cultural shift but also a political undertaking, rethinking dynamics of power and practice [172]. In the latter options, the question of legitimacy is raised on who gets to be a part of the decision-making process, taking on board transformative principles of inclusivity and diversity of voices.
